bibl.title: Letter from James Carroll to L. O. Howard, October 10, 1901

div1.p: Carroll sends Howard more samples of mosquitoes.

div1.head: Letter from James Carroll to L. O. Howard, October 10, 1901
div1.opener:
With white-banded feet--Culex probably confinis Lynch.
with unbanded feet -- Culex pungens Wied.
Las Animas Hospital,
Havana, Cuba, October 10, 1901.
My Dear D. Howard:
div1.p:
I send you by mail
today male & female of the genus psoro-
phira (?), and another pair that Guiteras
calls Saemorphyneus; to me they appear
to correspond more closely to Giles' # 41
Culex Confirmis (arribalzaga).

An answer sent within a day or
two will reach me here.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, James Carroll, Do you want any anopheles argyntarsis?
Dr. L. O. Howard,
U. S. Dept. Agriculture, Washington, D. C.
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
LITTERA
SCRIPTA
MAMET
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY AND PLANT QUARANTINE
Office of the Chief, Letters Received
Three Centimeters
